DefaultEvent.Description: $Port Cecil -> ポート・セシル$"The Principles. Port Cecil. Black and white and silver... please, take me there. Sooner, later, it doesn't matter. I know how complex the moves can be."
DefaultEvent.Name: A Chequered Character

RareDefaultEvent.Description: $Gaider's Mourn -> ゲイダーの嘆き$"The Corsair's Forest, please. Gaider's Mourn. No, I'm not in a hurry, but I think I might stay below decks. I don't carry the fee on me: you'll have to trust me for it when we arrive. Thank you. A pleasure."
RareDefaultEvent.Name: $Shady Sort -> 不審な人物$A Shady Sort

ChildBranches.Name: Pick up a passenger
ChildBranches.Description: $Mangrove College -> マングローブ・カレッジ$The Mangrove College is named for its scholars and philosophers. They have long abandoned civilised comforts for the life of the mind. Sometimes, they want those civilised comforts back.

DefaultEvent.Description: Tart morels and morel tart. The salty tang of zeeweed stew. A crawling berry that the locals assure you is a motile plant, not an insect. Eat your fill, and drink contemplatively.
DefaultEvent.Name: An explosion of tastes

ChildBranches.Name: Eat, drink, be merry
ChildBranches.Description: The philosophers of the College are not hospitable, but this whole shoreline is bursting with fruit and edible fungus. Reach up and it falls into your hand. Pick it up, and it's already fermented.

DefaultEvent.Description: Your crew strips a stretch of shoreline bare. It'll have burgeoned again by next week, no doubt.
DefaultEvent.Name: Wonderful things

ChildBranches.Name: Gather supplies
ChildBranches.Description: You don't have time to stop and rest, but you can gather plenty of supplies. The College members will grumble, but there's enough to go around

DefaultEvent.Description: [You can leave at any time, but if you get in far enough, you'll generally find something interesting.]
DefaultEvent.Name: Raise your lanterns high

ChildBranches.Name: $Wisp-Ways -> ウィスプ・ウェイズ$Into the Wisp-Ways
ChildBranches.Description: $[Ss]olacefruit -> サラスフルーツ$The swamps around the village are full of mud, crocodiles and vegetable treasures, including the notorious parasite called 'solacefruit'. The fogs and spreading branches occlude all light. [Take plenty of candles if you venture in.]

DefaultEvent.Description: It all makes sense now! Or sense enough, at least.
DefaultEvent.Name: A dozen strands, a single knot

ChildBranches.Name: Unpick the Mysteries of other Lands
ChildBranches.Description: The scholars of the College are hungry for lore. They'll help you put the pieces together. [This will convert these items to a Secret.]

DefaultEvent.Description: A Wary Hermit, her eyes bright, helps you sift truth from nonsense. By the end of it, she sighs with longing. 'The zee...' she says. "But no. I'm here for good."
DefaultEvent.Name: Vivid stories

ChildBranches.Name: Unpick the Mysteries of the Zee
ChildBranches.Description: Some of the 'philosophers' of the College have the grizzled air of old zailors. Retired mariners? Or pirates who've come here to avoid attention?

DefaultEvent.Description: $Adam's Way -> アダムの道, Whither -> ウィザー$Once inside the hut, you might imagine yourself back in London. Bright candle-light, thick carpets (a little spotted with damp), even wallpaper (similarly spotted). Two philosophers wait on you both, a little sulkily. The Enigmatic Gentleman will say nothing until you've both eaten dinner (a fine, if eclectic meal: cavern-trout, swamp-fruits, spices from Adam's Way and Whither, served on Delft ware at a lacquered Ming table). When you're done, he gives you a carefully itemised list of ship sightings, some excellent port and a little something to take away. "Remember me to the Admiral," he says fondly.
DefaultEvent.Name: An island of civilisation

ChildBranches.Name: Meet your contact
ChildBranches.Description: $Admiralty -> 海軍省$An Enigmatic Gentleman lives a comfortable life in the largest hut. He won't see you without an appointment, but the Admiralty has arranged that appointment.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Mangrove College -> マングローブ・カレッジ$The thinkers of the Mangrove College continue their untroubled and sedentary existence. New schools of philosophy are born and die like bubbles. Extraordinary poetries are written in water. The occasional retired pirate tries, and fails, to get invited to salons.
DefaultEvent.Name: All shall be well

ChildBranches.Name: $Port Report -> 港湾報告書$Compile a Port Report
ChildBranches.Description: Sages, scholars, philosophers, naturalists, poets, dreamers - here to pursue their rarefied ideals in a land of muddy fecundity.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Venderbight -> ヴェンダーバイト$A tall woman - imposing despite a layer of mud - opens the door. "Has he sent word?" she asks. She grins delightedly. "Let's be off. To Venderbight! Don't spare the engines. It's been too long."

ChildBranches.Name: $Venderbight -> ヴェンダーバイト$Pick up an Absent Friend for Venderbight
ChildBranches.Description: The directions take you to a frondy hovel in the shade of a swamp-oak. When you knock, the whole thing quivers as if it's come unmoored.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Officer -> オフィサー$"If anyone comes looking for me, well, I'm not accepting callers. Can I trust you to pass that on? You don't want them distracting me from my duties."[Appoint your new Officer by dragging her from the Officers tab to her slot at the top of the screen. Do this in port, not at sea, or you may unsettle your crew.]
DefaultEvent.Name: Welcome aboard!

ChildBranches.Name: $Officer -> オフィサー, Maybe's Daughter -> メイビーの娘$Engage an Officer: Maybe's Daughter
ChildBranches.Description: $Maybe's Daughter -> メイビーの娘$"Hello! Where are you headed? On second thoughts, I don't mind. Can I come aboard? Yes, I'm an engineer, but I'm an engineer in a hurry." [Maybe's Daughter is an Engineer who increases Veils, Iron and Engine Power.]

ChildBranches.Name: Go beachcombing
ChildBranches.Description: $Mangrove College -> マングローブ・カレッジ$Ships come and go to and from the Mangrove College, often in secret. What might they have flung overboard?

DefaultEvent.Description: $[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$It shows no interest in the village - it disappears straight into the jungle. There, little blemmigan. Thrive. Thrive and multiply.
DefaultEvent.Name: Into the wild

ChildBranches.Name: $[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$Put a blemmigan ashore
ChildBranches.Description: $[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$The college is already a crumbling mess more plant than village. Unleashing a blemmigan here will only hasten the decline. No matter.

DefaultEvent.Description: Your crew strips a stretch of shoreline bare. It'll have burgeoned again by next week, no doubt.
DefaultEvent.Name: Wonderful things

RareDefaultEvent.Description: $[Bb]lemmigan -> ブレミガン$Your crew returns sooner than you expected. One is nursing a badly bitten arm. Another bleeds from a scalp wound. A third is missing altogether. "Swarmed by blemmigans, captain," a survivor tells you, shivering. "Never saw the little monsters coming."
RareDefaultEvent.Name: A rush of purple!

ChildBranches.Name: Gather supplies
ChildBranches.Description: You don't have time to stop and rest, but you can gather plenty of supplies. The College members will grumble, but there's enough to go around

DefaultEvent.Description: $Port Cecil -> ポート・セシル$"The Principles. Port Cecil. Black and white and silver... please, take me there. Sooner, later, it doesn't matter. I know how complex the moves can be."
DefaultEvent.Name: A Chequered Character

RareDefaultEvent.Description: $Gaider's Mourn -> ゲイダーの嘆き$"The Corsair's Forest, please. Gaider's Mourn. No, I'm not in a hurry, but I think I might stay below decks. I don't carry the fee on me: you'll have to trust me for it when we arrive. Thank you. A pleasure."
RareDefaultEvent.Name: $Shady Sort -> 不審な人物$A Shady Sort

ChildBranches.Name: Pick up a passenger
ChildBranches.Description: $Mangrove College -> マングローブ・カレッジ$The Mangrove College is named for its scholars and philosophers. They have long abandoned civilised comforts for the life of the mind. Sometimes, they want those civilised comforts back.

ChildBranches.Name: An intent stare
ChildBranches.Description: There's a gentleman watching you rather closely. He may be mumbling to himself.

Description: A steaming sprawl of parasynthetic vegetation - and a village. Barely a village. Holed walls, roofs in disrepair, stilts leaning dangerously. It looks to have been assembled by drunks in a hurry. Dock carefully.
Name: $Mangrove College -> マングローブ・カレッジ$The Mangrove College
